revised_title: Regulation of Oxygen Demand in Soybean Bacteroids Utilizing Poly-3-hydroxybutyrate Reserves
tldr: The authors discovered that the supply of oxygen regulates the demand for oxygen during the utilization of poly-3-hydroxybutyrate reserves in nitrogen-fixing soybean bacteroids. They found that when oxygen supply increases, the demand for oxygen decreases, and when oxygen supply decreases, the demand for oxygen increases. This pattern helps maintain nitrogen fixation in soybean nodules.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
